sect2.title: Implementation specifics
sect2.para: The package is based on the the Oracle Call Interface (OCI) API. The choice was favoured with respect to OCCI, the C++ client library, in order to avoid potential problems which will arise with the non-availability of the OCCI library for a given C++ compiler, especially for the Linux platforms. The OCI API allows the implementation of the POOL Relational Abstraction Layer (RAL) interfaces in the most efficient way.
The shared library is linked against the Oracle instant client 10.2.0.1 libraries.
It is necessary that during runtime the relevant environment path variables are setup such the the Oracle client runtime libraries can be found.

listitem.para: RelationalAccess, is the package where the CORAL abstract interfaces are defined.
CoralCommon, is the package where some developer-level interfaces and some common implementation classes are defined.
